Reviews.Author: J. Martinez
Reviews.Content: Def loved this phone. Too many features to list. Bought a Net10 sim card package to use my phone. Used the AT&T; sim first it worked but the 3G wasn't available where I live but their network is strong here so couldn't understand why I wasn't receiving 3G. Replaced it with a T-Mobile sim and it works great.The sized of this phone is great. Love how thin it is and the vibrant colors of the screen. This phone works very fast and impressed with all the apps it has and the ones you can download. I just upgraded from a Huawei Ascend II and its a big improvement. Recommend this phone to every one.UPDATE:06.28.13The phone is great but there are some little issues been dealing with. The alarm on this phone sometimes doesnt work. Cant explain it either. It may give out 2 musical notes then shuts off by itsself. Wouldnt trust it if you're using it for a wake up alarm. I use my watch as a backup just in case the phone alarm doesnt go off.Also sometimes have to restart the phone cuz the 3G or 4G service will stop working. Unexplainable too. You will see the the data being sent but not being received back into the phone. So occasionally will have to restart the phone. Other than that it is still a great phone.

Reviews.Title: I really like this phone!
Reviews.Author: Thos "Sheik El"
Reviews.Content: Since I've had an i4s, and have used other phones before I rec'd this one, I am not "gushing" about the phone, however, it is a great phone, and I'm having no problems on the AT&T; network.  Being an unlocked phone, I will probably see about using it on T-mobile and Straight Talk as well.It came w/a European plug, but an adapter was included for use here, and it also came w/a USB cable for data and charging by computer or via USB charging adapter, so no big deal.  Set up was easy, however, if you purchase this phone, make sure that your carrier gives you a data plan for a Smartphone, if you've switched from an iPhone!Got a great cover, screen protector, and I'm set!  I noticed HDSPA show up in areas where available, and otherwise, it automatically sets for whatever signal your carrier provides. The built-in apps are a problem, because what you don't want/need, you can't remove, but, not gonna obsess over that, cause that's minor to me, and, other than having to get used to a different "look" w/the camera, I have no regrets over selling my iPhone, and getting my Mini Galaxy!Really like this phone!

Reviews.Title: So far so good...
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: This phone is really nice, I was looking for a mid-range smart phone and this seemed perfect for me. After a lot of research and comparing its specs with other brands I decided to buy it.(If you live in Venezuela keep reading 'till the end)I always has been a Sony Xperia user but I wanted to upgrade quickly. As you might know, the Xperia series is an amazing multimedia device, sounds great and their screens are beautiful.So, with that in mind I'll mention something important about this Samsung:1) The internal memory is only 4.5 Gb2) The phone hasn't a sensor to adjust the brithness automatically, I have to adjust it manually everytime.3) The sound quality of the built-in speaker and it's included earbuds are mediocre, they sound a bit loud, but that's it, the equalizer does not help at all. By the way, I have a pair of sennheiser headphones/earbuds and they do not work with the phone, the headphone jack is 3.5 mm but it appears to be constructed only to work properly with the included headphones.4) It doesn't have a light to tell when there's a unreaded message or to tell if the phone is charging or not.5) The quality of calls are just ok, sometimes I can't ever hear the other person talk.6) The battery life is very short, I have to charge it everyday for 2-3 hours minimun.7) Everything says "Made in China", The phone, the battery, the earbuds... everything!Aside from these cons, the phone is a great mid-range device...P.S. (Spanish):En Venezuela no levanta 3G con Digitel, no se si con Movistar o Movilnet tampoco porque no he probado aún. Lo compre a "ShopVius" por si les da curiosidad. El que levanta 3G con Digitel es el GT8190 y este es el GT-8190L

Reviews.Title: Awesome Phone Compared to iPhone
Reviews.Author: M. Crebs "lotz"
Reviews.Content: I did not buy this exact phone but I wanted to write a review about it because I am so impressed with it. Before getting my Samsung Galaxy s3 I had a iPhone 3gs. I was having a lot of problems with my iPhone even though I kept the updates current and tried my best to baby it when it was acting up. I was kind of over the whole iPhone thing so I decided on this phone. From day one I was so impressed with this phone I couldn't be more happy. The screen is bigger than what I was use to but I don't think it is too big. The screen is also very clear and the colors are very vivid. I am still learning all the fun little tricks you can do on this device but overall I think it is very easy to use. I was worried a little bit about the app store for an android phone but to tell you the truth it has all the apps I loved on my iPhone and some great new ones that I love using. If you are debating on a new phone this is a great phone to consider. I know some places certain colors and how much memory the phone has changes the price. So if you decide on this phone I would suggest getting the cheapest color because you most likely are gonna put a cover on it right!? So it doesn't really matter what the color is. Also I would suggest getting the least memory if it is cheaper than the higher ones because you can always add a card for more memory which is a lot cheaper than paying for more memory on your phone. If anyone has any questions on using the phone I would be happy to give my opinion and answer the best I can.

Reviews.Title: Should have spent the extra money
Reviews.Author: John Watson
Reviews.Content: I am an AT&T; customer in upstate NY.  I took my SIM out of my 4G Galaxy SII and put it in this phone.  Reading the description and reviews I was under the impression I would get 4G.  At worst 3G.  Well, all I can get is the EDGE network.  The phone came in the default setting of French.  Had I not known the Samsung platform (I've owned the Captivate and SII) I wouldn't have been able to figure out how to get to English.  The phone is too small to type on and it doesn't have auto correct, it has the predictive word feature.  Don't even think of getting accessories for this phone in America.  The AT&T; store didn't even know what the heck I handed them.  The guys there have never seen or heard of this phone.  You can't find a case.  When someone calls you and you miss the call you can't go into the call log to call them back.  The default layout of the phone shows international calls.  It doesn't come up as (555) 555-5555.  It shows up as +5555555555.  I still haven't been able to figure that out months later.  I used that feature a bunch on my Galaxy SII. Being a business owner I get calls from people all the time that are not in my contact list.  The camera is horrible and there is so much junk loaded on this phone when it comes it bogs down just trying to get out of it's own way.  Even when you restart the phone or turn it on the phone uses over 400 of the 800MB of Ram.  I could go on and on about how much I hate this phone.  Spend a few extra bucks and get something better.  The only reason I bought this phone is because I dropped my SII (first phone I've ever ruined and I started with a Motorola Startac) and can't upgrade for 8 months.  When I get my new phone I will recreate the "Office Space" scene in the field with the fax machine with this phone.  I can't express how much I hate this phone.

Reviews.Title: defective equipment ...
Reviews.Author: Carlos Vasquez
Reviews.Content: In spanish... Compré el teléfono desde Venezuela, para ser usado en Venezuela, en Barquisimeto... El equipo llego a mi casa despues del 26 de diciembre, debido a retrasos del courier que contrate... Funcionó al principio bien, le instale facebook, whatsapp, twitter, lo normal... una semana despues de ser entregado comenzo a recalentarse de tal manera q se consumia la bateria en menos de una hora... Le desinstale todas las aplicaciones y aun asi seguia recalentandose... lo lleve al servicio técnico autorizado samsung aca en mi ciudad y me informaron que el IMEI no estaba registrado por lo que consideraban que el teléfono era una copia (IMEI: 359684/15/664597/8) ... Lo lleve a revisión de un técnico samsung particular y me informa que el problema lo tiene la placa base que está defectuosa, se le cambió la bateria y se probó con una caja de servicios para teléfonos moviles, dando el defecto en la placa base... El teléfono no se puede usar debido a que se consume la bateria en una hora, y le instale una aplicación (la única que tiene) que mide la temperatura del sistema y ha llegadpo hasta 46° centigrados... Agradezco por favor darme respuesta de que debo hacer para que me solucionen este problema, ya que el equipo me llego defectuoso...I bought the phone from Venezuela , to be used in Venezuela , in Barquisimeto ... The phone came to my home after Dec. 26 due to courier delays to hire ... It worked well at first , it will install facebook, whatsapp, twitter , normal ... one week after being handed started to overheat so q battery was consumed in less than an hour ... I uninstall all applications and yet was still overheating ... authorized tecnics here in my city samsung service center and was informed that the IMEI was not registered by what they saw that the phone was a copy ( IMEI: 359684/15/664597/8 ) ... A technical review of samsung owners and informs me that the problem is the motherboard that is defective, the battery was changed and tested with a box service for mobile phones, giving the defect in the motherboard .. . The phone can not be used because the battery is consumed in an hour, and I install an application ( the only one you have) that measures the temperature of the system and has up to 46 ° Celsius ... Answer please, that I should do to solve this problem as I get defective equipment ...

Reviews.Title: 8 Gb is not enough!
Reviews.Author: Not Much of a Cook
Reviews.Content: I like this phone a lot except for one thing. Am thinking of asking the seller if I can upgrade it. The problem is that 8 Gb of RAM isn't enough if you want to take advantage of the Android system to the fullest. One of the selling points of the Android system (for me) was that it can do so much, and it looks like that takes lots of RAM.  I've had it for a week now and have downloaded quite a few apps but not all that many. The problem is that the system files and bloatware take up almost half of the memory. And you can save music and video files, and books and photos, to the external micro SD card, but not apps. All your apps have to fit into the built-in ram, not into the SD card you insert yourself. And if you want to download big apps you'll run up against warnings that the memory is full. I was trying to download a Wikipedia app when this happened to me. I suspect that there are lots of games that take a lot of memory, too.I read on the net that you could root the phone and download an app that would save your apps to the external micro SD card, but I'm not that adventurous.So I did a factory reset and deleted some apps. And re-installed some of the apps I wanted. BUT I'm not happy having to do that. The largest micro SD card the SIII Mini will take is 32 Gb, and I was really disappointed at not being able to use that for apps. And it spoils the thrill to have to worry about using all my RAM. There are lots of threads about this issue on Android Central, which I recommend for anyone considering this phone.Another issue I ran into was that the wi-fi wouldn't connect. Android Central has lots of discussions of this problem. I tried lots of fixes but what worked was that I had been putting in the wrong password. You put in the WEP password. There is another password that I'd written down but it wasn't the one that I'd needed. So just make sure you have the right password.I looked through the reviews before I ordered but didn't see anything about these two issues anywhere on-line.

Reviews.Title: UPDATE GPS not working.  Phone AOK but Amazon should change their 2 day Amazon Prime shipping policy
Reviews.Author: M. Pun
Reviews.Content: ... so that if a vendor is unable to fulfill it then it isn't offered. The phone was not shipped for 4 days after purchase.  Site says they have the inventory. Not too bent out but a bit annoyed.ADDENDA. Finally got the phone  No complaints about the phone itself so farPhone arrived in factory sealed condition.All components present and accounted for. Battery for instance was a sealed in package Samsung stock battery. So that was fine.opened it up, added my old SIM card and battery, turned on and everything AOK. Power at 20% so charging as one should always do. Did not take long to charge to 50%.  Checked out a few things. got the bluetooth to talk with my plantronics, checked out a few things. Bit of a learning curve on my part although I do have the Kindle tablet that intro'd me to Android.Cute phone. Got the CIMO cover for it. Have more instructions to read. The S Voice looked nice but they want pretty much all of your information if you do. Not too comfy with that yet. Maybe later.  GPS not the paragon of precision although this may be a Google map issue. Showed the location to be about 500+ feet (about half a block) from actual location so would not use it for semi precise guidance. Tried the FM radio. Good for fairly strong stations.Big complaint about the phone loudness for the FM Radio. AUDIO LEVEL at lowest setting, 1, is TOO LOUD!!!! WTF!!!!! Do they have deaf people in their testing labs? Fer crying out loud I am 59, had my ears blown out by everyone from Steppenwolf to the Dead Kennedys in the basement of a student Co-op. This is ridiculous. Turning down system audio level does not help. Cannot use standard 3 contact stereo headphone jacks. Uses a 4 contact one.11/14/13Well just realized that the GPS probably hasn't been on most of the time I have used it. SO the question is the GPS broken or is it a function of the 4.1.1 OS. May upgrade to 4.1.2 manually.Several other things, this is a Brit version so no domestic support. with AT&T; that may include not upgrading the phone to 4.1.2  KIES won't do it because it has the wrong version of firmware. I hope it works because other than the GPS - my MAIN reason for purchase, this is a great smartphone.

Reviews.Title: "Perfect" size
Reviews.Author: Neur0n
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone because I wanted a somewhat high end phone that is shaped and sized to what I wanted.  The size of this phone seems "perfect" in my hands and I can use it with just one hand.  The screen looks vibrant and everything runs smoothly (so far).  I feel that this phone is more aesthetic than the bigger Galaxy SIII simply because it's smaller.  However I should note that the bigger Galaxy SIII has better specs than the miniature version.  I also liked that it's compatible with T-mobile.However I experienced massive delays on this phone that I haven't with other phones.  I don't think the phone is slow, and It's also not a T-mobile's network issue.  I'm thinking it has to do with the antennae or compatibility issues with the phone itself.  Whenever I go inside a building, I lose connection in most buildings.  I did not lose connection with my other Nokia phone using the same network.  Additionally there would be times the bars in the same spot would randomly go up and down for no apparent reason - meaning that sometimes in the same spot (for example my room) I could make calls or I can't make calls at all.  However my Nokia had no issues.  So I concluded that it has something to do with the phone.  With that said, it works with T-mobile most of the time, but I found those issues to be an annoyance.Overall It's hard to say whether or not this phone is worth it because from what I been reading, it seems to be a location issue.  So some places it might work just fine while other places it won't.  Assuming that you don't have the delay issue that I do, then this phone is definitely solid.  Although it's quickly getting outdated with new phones coming out with high end quad cores and 13mp cameras.

Reviews.Title: Revised.  BIG issues, doesn't charge properly.
Reviews.Author: Vince Paruta
Reviews.Content: Revised:  Big issue, doesnt' charge properly or recognize that it is charged when it is.  It's a software issue and since its an international phone, I do not believe there is a warranty claim I can make on this.  I'm nursing it along for months now, factory reboots, re booting by removing the battery, I have nursed it back to  85% reliability from 40% reliable.  Will never buy another international phone again.  It's technology and when it breaks, you are on your own.  Should have bought the Apple 4S to get this form factor.  10-30-2013Still learning the ins and outs of my first smart phone, sad and glad I got the mini, nice form factor, but I've seen the S3 and Note and wow, what a screen!  Anyway, I know mine will survive skiing, rollerblading, etc, with less drops because I can pocket the mini much more conveniently.  I found the HH Hand Held Devices cases work great and a holster made for iPhone 4's work pretty damn good.  Fits nicely.  The phone call quality is great, data side works smoothly, touch screen is good, but tough for texting, Blackberry keyboard was much nicer with it's tactile feedback.  Battery life is fair, seems to be improving with use and some juice saving measures, don't use GPS and WiFi when not needed, get black screen background.  Lower screen light level when indoors, but DO put it up to maximum when outdoors in order to see in sunlight. (still a little tough, need to be in shade).  Wish it had a notification light like Blackberry, have to press buttons to see status on this one. It's ok, you get used to it pretty quick, but can't see status from across room if you leave it on the kitchen counter.  One negative is too much bloat ware,  had to go to settings to Uninstall alot of it, still figuring out what else to dump.  Jelly Bean 4.1.2 works great, no problems so far. Oh yes, when I got the phone it started up in German, couldn't read it.....scary!...but go to YOuTube and search change S3 Mini language, it was pretty easy after that...Will update further in future, but 6 weeks in, I give it 4 stars. I paid 325 for it 2 months ago, is now 275.  You decide when you should buy it, obviously its coming down in price.

Reviews.Title: excellent phone, no NFC
Reviews.Author: etank
Reviews.Content: definitely no NFC apparent, despite it still being listed in the descriptionother than that, it's an excellent phone if you don't want something big.  It's slightly smaller than an iphone 5, you don't feel like you're going to scratch the surface, etc.  It's a bit under-powered and the screen could be better (higher res).  Given those factors I would have expected better battery life than it has, but the battery gets me reliably through the day as long as don't have the screen very bright (which I find acceptable.It has too much Samsung junk that you can't uninstall. It's annoying to bloat the phone up out of the box with that, but even more annoying to make it impossible to remove.They've buried the WiFi hotspot settings and generally made this much less usable than it was on previous Samsung Galaxy models that I've had; I haven't researched whether this is an Android change or a Samsung change.  It's just annoying, as I tether over wifi to my phone a lot when traveling.

Reviews.Title: Finally arrived at T-Mobile as Galaxy Exhibit
Reviews.Author: Foglifter
Reviews.Content: This phone has finally made its way to brick-and-mortar stores in the US: as of April 29, 2013 T-Mobile sells it under the name "Galaxy Exhibit" for $235 (or $20 down and $9/month for 2 years). The name is quite confusing as a couple years ago Samsung came up with another similarly-named phone "Samsung Galaxy Exhibit 4G (T-Mobile),  t679" running Android 2.3. However, this phone does support 4G, even though it's not reflected in its name.Strangely, the status bar at the store was showing "4G" although the list of networks mode in the phone settings only shows GSM/WCDMA and GSM only - precisely the same settings that you'll see in S3 Mini. My daughter owns the original S3 Mini and it shows "H" on T-Mobile network instead of "4G" - which probably means HSPA+ (T-Mobile's version of 4G).The phone looks identical to S3 Mini and the only difference that I noticed is the list of available languages in the settings: unlike S3 Mini, which supports a few dozen languages, Galaxy Exhibit only supports a handful of languages.I wonder if this will push Amazon prices on S3 Mini down a bit.

So I returned it sadly because it was a cool phone .. It was also T Mobile and Tmobile doesn't work with Straight Talk. The phone starts in German, which you shouldn't over look. It starts in German because its a UK phone. I hope this has been of some help to someone so they too don't get taken for a ride. I shipped the phone back to Amazon for a refund.

Reviews.Title: Dangerous "stupid" phone
Reviews.Author: Ossie Sharon
Reviews.Content: My experience with this product has been a nightmare, from the beginning, without it having ever being dropped, exposed to water, anything. True, some of them are just the curse - yes, CURSE - of touchscreen (baby)technology, which is still quite lame compared to real buttons. And no, these are not "malfunctions," they are design flaws, period - I saw these same issues on other minis.The following are the anti-features you can expect:- a touch screen that often does not respond at the speed demanded - this creates a HUGE risk during driving, when a user has to avert his/her eyes to try, try, try, try, try to answer and activate the speaker (and end the call), especially as the screen repeatedly blacks out (for what? to save the pathetic battery power?) and canNOT be quickly revived. This is particularly fun when answering calls from clients, who do not expect to wait as this little piece of crap decides if and when its owner can answer it, or when dealing with automated systems that don't understand why it takes so long to press the directed key.- the telephone shuts itself off without being touched, and even with a full battery- the telephone cuts off the internet connection on a regular basis, without being touched, without a change in location, even in the middle of an online function during what a second ago had been an active connection. This did not happen to me with my previous telephones.- press on the SMS button, frequently get the camera - repeatedly - until the mail decides to wake up- try to send an SMS, and it tells you it failed even when it didn't, or that it was sent even when it failed; wait 4 days to get an important SMS- try to send an SMS, and it hides the "create new mail" function for a few hours- receive an SMS, and occasionally have to guess who sent it, while being thankful that at least it was designed to display the name/number of the sender- press on the missed calls function, get the last person YOU called- search for a number in your phone, Russian roulette if it comes up- and of course, the battery drains very, very, very quickly when you use it for internet accessIf you need your telephone to really function, try another company. Any suggestion that a more expensive phone is necessary is criminal, as the above issues have to do with very basic functions that should be expected at what is already quite a high price, given that the assemblers make less than minimum wage.

Reviews.Title: Cheaply made phone
Reviews.Author: bramsey2016
Reviews.Content: The Samsung Galaxy S3 is a horribly made phone. After the second week of owning this phone the screen shattered after falling on my carpet matt floor. A couple months later the phone would not hold a charge more than and hour. I had to buy a new charger because the one that came with the phone stopped working. Last week the phone stopped charging completely. After reading many reviews about the phone needing the charging port replaced by THOUSANDS of different owners of this phone I contacted customer service. Since the screen shattered they would not replace the charging port even though it is obviously a manufacturing error. This company is horrible a phone purchased at $500 they will not even repair. Horrible product cheaply made horrible customer service not willing to admit fault with their own product even though it is well documented all over the internet. Not to mention all the bugs the phone has.
